mig.view

Class DirectionPanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • mig.view.DirectionPanel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class DirectionPanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel
    DirectionPanel is a class representing the direction accessible for the played in the game. The player can move in a direction if a door exist in this direction

    A DirectionPanel contains these elements

    • The player can move at the direction north
    • The player can move at the direction south
    • The player can move at the direction east
    • The player can move at the direction west
    • The player can go upstairs
    • The player can go down to the ground floor
    Version:
    22/11/2016
    Author:
    Group 8
    See Also:

    • Constructor Detail

      • DirectionPanel

        public DirectionPanel(Window window,
                      Game game)
        Method to display the directions in the interface. It exist 5 directions possible: north, east, south, west, up/down.
        Parameters:
        game - The game currently played.
        window - The window currently played.

    • Method Detail

      • openDoor

        public void openDoor(Door door)
        Method to open the door if it is closed. It is possible to open the door with a code or a lock.
        Parameters:
        door - The door currently played.

      • updateAccess

        public void updateAccess()
        Method to activated the button of the direction. The button is activated if the door is present at the direction.
